newsitem.title: BURMA: Burma arrests 38 Thais for illegal logging.
newsitem.headline: Burma arrests 38 Thais for illegal logging.

text.p: Burmese troops have arrested 38 Thai nationals and six Burmese as they were attempting to smuggle teak timber out of the country, the official Myanmar News Agency said on Thursday.
Thai authorities on the border with Burma's eastern Shan state, which is also a transit point for opium and heroin traffickers, said they had no information about the arrests.
The news agency said that the 44 were arrested on May 24 and 25 after the military received information about illegal logging in the Ponpakyem district, some 640 km (400 miles) northeast of Rangoon.

"They captured 38 Thai nationals and six Myanmar nationals illegally extracting timber and seized five motor vehicles used in smuggling timber out of the country, one tractor, two elephants, six engines, one circular saw, two chain saws, eight tonnes of sawn teak and 39 teak logs," it said.
"Legal action will be taken against them," it added.
The Thai embassy in Rangoon said it had no information about the arrests.
Timber has long been smuggled from Burma into Thailand, where years of heavy logging has deforested many parts of the country.
